ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: when we have become perished, worm-eaten bones?'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: After having turned to carious bones?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: even after we have been reduced to bones, hollow and rotten?”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: after we have become bones and dust?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Even after we are bones Nakhirah"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: What! when we are rotten bones?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: What, when we are bones old and wasted?'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Even after we are crumbled bones?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: even after we have turned into decayed bones?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: When we have become bones decayed!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: What, even after we have been decayed bones?!’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: What! - when we shall have become rotten bones?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Even after we are crumbled bones?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: even after we are fragmented bones'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: When we have become hollow bones?”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Even if we should be decayed bones?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [79:11] What! When we have been decayed bones?’ (nakhira: a variant reading has nākhira, ‘decayed and withered’), will we have life again?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Even after we are crumbled bones?) Will Allah resurrect us? How is this possible?
